form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Screeneded by NARA, 9/21/2023, NARA Form No. 850-467

full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 Q. What is your true and correct name? A. Mao, Pei-Eng. Also, when I was in Shanghai, Betty Pei-Eng Mao. Q. Have you ever used any other names? A. No. Q. On what date were you born? A. In Chinese calendar - CR 3-10-27, it corresponds to October 27, 1914. Q. Where wereyou born? A. Shanghai, China. Q. Of what country are you a citizen? A. China. Q. What is your present address? A. 720 South San Rafael, Pasadena, California. Q. Are you in the United States as an immigrant? A. Yes, I am an immigrant. Q. I now show you an immigrant visa which reflects that Mao, Pei-Eng was admitted to the United States at Honolulu, Hawaii, January 17, 1968, as a class P6-1 immigrant. INVESTIGATOR'S NOTE: Respondent shown aforementioned immigrant visa, as contained in Service file A17 181 791. Do you believe that the visa that I am showing you, which contains a photograph, relates to you and to your admission to the United States? A. Yes. Q. The application for this visa contains the signature of Betty Mao. I wish to show you the signature, and ask you if this is your signature? INVESTIGATOR's NOTE: Respondent shown aforementioned visa application, signature page, as contained in Service file A17 181 791. Is this your signature? A. Yes. Q. According to a Petition and Application for Alien Employment Certification, you claimed to be entering the United States to work for Mr. and Mrs. Erle B. Halliburton of Corona del Mar, California. Do you believe that this is correct? A. Yes. 2 -
